page.title: 09SHOPPING CENTRE: BROWNHILLS.
page.content: The principal planning officer for the Walsall Metropolitan Borough was interviewed on Tuesday, 12th June 1985. He was asked about the main objective of the new development in Brownhills. He said that they were trying to make Brownhills a district shopping centre for the whole of the North East Walsall area, including places such as Pelsall, Shelfield and Aldridge. They were also hoping to attract people from the nearby Staffordshire area. As well as a new hypermarket, open market and shops, there would be a DIY superstore and other shops to sell durable goods. Transport improvements were also to take place to ease congestion in Brownhills High Street. These would include new service roads, traffic islands, and parking facilities.
